thread.title: Delta Q2 earnings spiked 85% to $10.7 billion
thread.title_full: Delta Q2 earnings spiked 85% to $10.7 billion

author: Brittney Laryea
title: Delta Q2 earnings spiked 85% to $10.7 billion
text:
Delta Q2 earnings spiked 85% to $10.7 billion Jul 15, 2015, 10:05am EDT Updated Jul 15, 2015, 11:03am EDT Share Brittney Laryea Editorial Intern Atlanta Business Chronicle Brittney Laryea Editorial Intern Atlanta Business Chronicle Related Content Enlarge Davia Anderson Delta Air Lines Inc. overcame $160 million in foreign currency pressures to generate an 85 percent spike in second-quarter profit. The Atlanta-based airline reported second-quarter revenue was up 1 percent to $10.7 billion, while profit soared 85 percent to $1.5 billion, or $1.83 a share. Delta (NYSE: DAL) noted Branded Fares boosted passenger revenue by $56 million and its enhanced agreement with American Express garnered $60 million in revenue. Adjusted fuel expense declined over $463 million compared to the same period in 2014, as 39 percent lower market fuel prices and a $77 million increase in profit at Delta’s refinery in Trainer, Pa., offset nearly $600 million in settled hedge losses. “Our commercial initiatives continue to gain traction in the marketplace and we will produce summer margins in excess of any achieved in our history,” Delta President Ed Bastian said, in a statement. “However, unit revenue growth is an important component of our long-term plan to expand margins. We continue to project flat system capacity growth for the fourth quarter of 2015 – a level in line with current demand expectations, which should put the business on the right trajectory to stem the erosion in unit revenues by the end of the year.”
